metadata.Title: CVE-2012-6140 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
pam_google_authenticator.c in the PAM module in Google Authenticator before 1.0 requires user-readable permissions for the secret file, which allows local users to bypass intended access restrictions and discover a shared secret via standard filesystem operations, a different vulnerability than CVE-2013-0258.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2012-6140` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libpam-google-authenticator - 20110413.68230188bdc7-1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: google-authenticator package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '20110413.68230188bdc7-1.1').
